title: Offline mode
body: I think it will be awesome if the game had an appear offline mode. Any reason why its not in the client yet?

replies.body:
It's a MOBA for a reason.
I doubt there would be anything that you could do offline on League. Even playing with bots.
I don't see why/how appearing offline would ruin the MOBA experience :/

You can't do anything in League anyways. Even like changing masteries. They would have to resync everything when you go back online, which then websites who use the API for reading runes and masteries i.e lolking would have to reupdate.

You can't do anything in League anyways. Even like changing masteries. They would have to resync everything when you go back online, which then websites who use the API for reading runes and masteries i.e lolking would have to reupdate.  

Also offline bot behaviour comes from the riot servers, so offline bots wouldn't be an option.
Yeah lets just give every hacker the code.
What does appear offline implemented into the client has to do with giving the game code to all hackers?

They pretty much already have it. It's not like it's incredibly complex to reverse engineer, Rito logs every single thing. They're amazing in that.
Unfortunately for hackers, the game is server-sided, so there's really nothing to "hack".

He/she said "appear offline" mode, most likely so their friends don't bombard them with game invites. No idea why it's not in the client yet though. There's a lot Rito hasn't got around to in regards to their client.

We made that a while ago for iLoL.
Never updated it after the project was shut down, however :/ But it shouldn't be impossible to make, if you find someone to work on it.
